hints.content: For $\dfrac12$ and $\dfrac48$ to be equivalent, they must be fractions of  the same size whole.
Which image shows $\dfrac12$ and $\dfrac48$ represented on the same size whole?

options.alt: Two circles that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the two circles. The top circle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom circle is divided into 8 equal parts. Four parts are shaded. !

Two circles that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the two circles. The top circle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom circle is divided into 8 equal parts. Four parts are shaded. !

choices.content: ![Two circles that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the two circles. The top circle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom circle is divided into 8 equal parts. Four parts are shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0df6342c22d5ef13aae3ed6a22c88204eb869c3e)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/48a7508dbc7adf7ddb63149b915142b0b72fcffb)

![Two irregular polygons with 6 sides. The shape of the polygons is the same. There is an equal sign between the two polygons. The top polygon is small. It is divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom polygon is bigger. It is divided into 8 equal parts. Four parts are shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fcc4749d68beda45ed661100b2528fa81c2ddc9e)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a6f6f8dfc2cb1027e8deb6b7b16feac3942931d8)

![Two squares. There is an equal sign between the two squares. The top square is small. It is divided into 2 equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom square is bigger. It is divided into 8 equal parts. Four parts are shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/549f1d577fd63dcf455e24f9ff9937b21d9a4e15)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1e0442550c6379b8c8cb263daaf20e32fbe046d9)
